alert.note: Alert for Emanuel; Glascock; Hancock; Jefferson; Johnson; Taliaferro; Warren; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 1:19PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Wilkinson, northeastern Emanuel, Warren, eastern Hancock, Glascock, Washington, southeastern Taliaferro, northern Johnson and Jefferson Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 119 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms extended from near Mesena to near Downs to near Tuckers Crossroad, and moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Sandersville, Louisville, Wrightsville, Warrenton, Gibson, Wrens, Wadley, Davisboro, Tennille, Harrison, Toomsboro, Stapleton, Bartow, Oconee, Avera, Norwood, Garfield, Mitchell, Summertown and Sharon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Emanuel; Glascock; Hancock; Jefferson; Johnson; Taliaferro; Warren; Washington; Wilkinson
